intro: Agrostemma × walkeri, commonly known as the hybrid wallflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Agrostemma githago and other related species, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant typically produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. Agrostemma × walkeri is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
